title: â€œ867â€ and â€œ867-5309â€ Meanings, Origins & Other Popular Texting Abbreviations

steps.title: â€œ867â€ is a texting code for getting drunk and waking up in someoneâ€™s bed.
steps.content: â€œ867â€ is a texting code for getting drunk and waking up in someoneâ€™s bed. Most people experience an â€œ867â€ (or â€œget 867â€™edâ€) by drinking too much alcohol and blacking out. They probably donâ€™t know when, how, or why theyâ€™re in a personâ€™s bed, or for how long theyâ€™ve been there. [1] X Research source â€œI 867â€™ed and I donâ€™t remember anything ğŸ˜«â€ â€œIâ€™m never drinking tequila again. I 867â€™ed and I donâ€™t know their name ğŸ˜­ğŸ’€ğŸ˜­ğŸ’€â€ â€œDid you get 867â€™ed last night? I noticed you werenâ€™t home when I got back.â€ The exact origin of the texting code â€œ867â€ is unknown, but it may have started in the late 90s when people used pagers to communicate with each other.

steps.title: â€œ867-5309â€ is a reference to the 1981 pop song by Tommy Tutone.
steps.content: â€œ867-5309â€ is a reference to the 1981 pop song by Tommy Tutone. In slang, the number â€œ867â€ can be a nod to the famous phone number from the chorus of the song, which is called â€œ867-5309/Jenny.â€ The song is not related to the texting code â€œ867â€ in any way, but it's about a man who finds a phone number on a wall, with the name â€œJennyâ€ next to it. He becomes obsessed with the idea of having a romantic relationship with Jenny, but is too nervous to call her. [2] X Research source The song peaked at #4 on the Billboard Hot 100 Chart in May 1982. [3] X Research source However, it was the only major success from the band, giving Tommy Tutone the reputation as a â€œone-hit wonder.â€

steps.title: Co-writer Alex Call says he came up with the phone number randomly.
steps.content: Co-writer Alex Call says he came up with the phone number randomly. While there are conflicting stories about the creation of the song, Call has explained in several interviews that the name â€œJennyâ€ and the phone number â€œ867-5309â€ came to him â€œout of ether,â€ and that neither him or lead guitarist Jim Keller had a real person or number in mind. [4] X Research source In fact, some people say that other members of the band make up a new story every time theyâ€™re asked about the origins of the song. Tommy Heath, the lead singer, once claimed that he got the phone number from a girl who wanted him to give it to Jim Keller. Additionally, Jim Keller has claimed that Jenny was a girl he knew and that some of his friends wrote her number on the wall of a menâ€™s room as a joke.

steps.title: The song wreaked havoc for people with the actual phone number.
steps.content: The song wreaked havoc for people with the actual phone number. As the song gained popularity in the 80s, it caused a trend of prank calls and harassment for anyone with the phone number. Kids began calling â€œ867-5309â€ in their area codes and asking for â€œJenny,â€ which forced some people to disconnect or change their number. [5] X Research source This wave of prank calling may have helped cement â€œ867-5309/Jennyâ€ in pop culture. The song is associated with humor and nostalgia, and has been featured in marketing and advertising campaigns, TV shows, movies, comedy sketches, Internet memes and more. Businesses are interested in the number because itâ€™s recognizable and easy to remember, so some people seek the number for the sole purpose of selling it. [6] X Research source Single people can also use it as a fake number when they donâ€™t want to give out their real number. The song title has sparked debate among fans, with some calling it â€œ867-5309â€ and others calling it â€œ867-5309 (Jenny).â€ Many people also confuse the â€œ6â€ and the â€œ7,â€ misremembering the number as â€œ876-5309.â€ On major streaming platforms, the song is listed as â€œ867-5309/Jenny.â€ [7] X Research source

steps.title: The 867 area code is for northern Canada.
steps.content: The 867 area code is for northern Canada. Area code 867 serves the Northwest Territories, Nunavut, and Yukon. It includes all cities, towns, villages, and hamlets in the region, such as Cambridge Bay, Inuvik, and Rankin Inlet. The Canadian territories the area code on October 21, 1997. Some people believe 867 was selected because it spells out â€œTOPâ€ on a telephone pad, which is short for â€œtop of the world.â€ [8] X Research source

steps.title: Use any of these texting abbreviations to spice up your conversation.
steps.content: Use any of these texting abbreviations to spice up your conversation. Internet and texting slang became widespread with the rise of mobile phones, especially since people had limited space for messages. [9] X Research source Texting abbreviations, like â€œ867,â€ make for a quick and efficient conversation, so use any of the following options to express your feelings with close friends and family: WYD = what you doing WBU = what about you AF = as f*** BC = because IDC = I donâ€™t care ILYSM = I love you so much GTG = got to go FYI = for your information IDK = I donâ€™t know DW = donâ€™t worry IRL = in real life BRB = be right back RN = right now LMAO = laughing my a** off TTYL = talk to you later NGL = not gonna lie FS = for sure GN = good night GM = good morning TMI = too much information WTH = what the hell WTF = what the f*** GC = group chat WYA = where ya at OMG = oh my god ONG = on God BF = boyfriend GF = girlfriend TBH = to be honest ATM = at the moment ATP = at this point YK = you know STFU = shut the f*** up SMH = shaking my head IMY = I miss you MB = my bad GG = good game PLS = please NVM = never mind
